Docs.summary: Represents a document viewing control that can host paginated content such as an .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Customizing the DocumentViewer Control To apply the same property settings to multiple DocumentViewer controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property. You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance. For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). To see the parts and states that are specific to the DocumentViewer, see [DocumentViewer Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style. If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application. The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running. For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in DocumentViewer control's default template and is set by using a . You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DecreaseZoom() cil managed

Docs.summary: Zooms out of the document content by one zoom step.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following are the zoom level increments.
`5% 100% 1200%`
`10% 125% 1600%`
`25% 150% 2000%`
`33% 175% 2400%`
`50% 200% 3200%`
`66% 300% 4000%`
`75% 400% 5000%`
`800%`
The minimum zoom level is 5%. After the minimum zoom level is reached, DecreaseZoom has no more effect.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false` when the minimum zoom level is reached.

Docs.summary: Gets the overall vertical height of the paginated document.
Docs.value: The overall vertical height of the paginated content specified in device independent pixels. The default is 0.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For vertical page arrangements, ExtentHeight is the sum of all the page heights and includes the space between pages. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ExtentHeightProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ExtentHeight%2A> dependency property.
Gets the overall horizontal width of the paginated document.
Docs.value: The current horizontal width of the content layout area specified in device independent pixels. The default is 0.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For horizontal page arrangements, ExtentWidth is the sum of all the page widths and includes the space between pages. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToWidth%2A> sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer> control to display a single page width with pages zoomed to the width of the current viewport.

Docs.param: When this method returns, contains if the collection of elements changed after the last call to GetPageViewsCollection; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of elements that are currently displayed.
Docs.returns: The collection of elements that are currently displayed in the control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal scroll position.
Docs.value: The current horizontal scroll position specified in device independent pixels. The initial default is 0.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting the HorizontalOffset property causes the control to scroll to the specified horizontal offset. The horizontal offset is measured from the left edge of the visible content area. When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Width" or "Horizontal" properties. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**||

Docs.exception: The value specified to set is negative.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty HorizontalOffsetProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.HorizontalOffset%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the horizontal space between pages.
Docs.value: The horizontal space between displayed pages specified in device independent pixels. The default is 10.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting the HorizontalPageSpacing property adjusts the horizontal spacing between pages. When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Width" or "Horizontal" properties. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

Docs.exception: The value specified to set is negative.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void IncreaseZoom() cil managed

Docs.summary: Zooms in on the document content by one zoom step.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following are the zoom level increments.
`5% 100% 1200%`
`10% 125% 1600%`
`25% 150% 2000%`
`33% 175% 2400%`
`50% 200% 3200%`
`66% 300% 4000%`
`75% 400% 5000%`
`800%`
The maximum zoom value is 5000%. After the maximum zoom level is reached, IncreaseZoom has no more effect.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanIncreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false` when the maximum zoom level is reached.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value defining the maximum number of page columns to display.
Docs.value: The maximum number of page columns to be displayed. The default is 1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks MaxPagesAcross can be set to a positive integer value from 1 to 32, inclusive. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether drop-shadow page borders are displayed.
Docs.value: if drop-shadow borders are displayed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ShowPageBordersProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ShowPageBorders%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the vertical scroll position.
Docs.value: The current vertical scroll position offset in device independent pixels. The default is 0.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks VerticalOffset must be set with non-negative offset values. Setting a negative value raises an exception. The vertical offset is measured from the top of the visible content area. When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Height" or "Vertical" properties. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty VerticalOffsetProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.VerticalOffset%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the vertical spacing between displayed pages.
Docs.value: The vertical space between displayed pages in device independent pixels. The default is 10.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting the VerticalPageSpacing property adjusts the vertical spacing between pages to the specified value. The VerticalPageSpacing value must be non-negative. Setting this property to a negative value will raise an exception. When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Height" or "Vertical" properties. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty VerticalPageSpacingProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.VerticalPageSpacing%2A> dependency property.
Gets the vertical size of the scrollable content area.
Docs.value: The vertical size of the scrollable content area in device independent pixels. The default is 0.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

Docs.value: The horizontal size of the scrollable content area in device independent pixels. The default is 0.0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ViewThumbnails() cil managed

Docs.summary: Displays a thumbnail representation of the pages.
Gets the that performs the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewThumbnails%2A> operation.
Docs.value: The routed command that performs the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewThumbnails%2A> operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ViewThumbnailsCommand sizes and arranges the view to display a thumbnail preview of each page.
The following table shows the keyboard shortcut key associated with this command.
||| |-|-| |Shortcut Key|[none]|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the document zoom percentage.
Docs.value: The zoom percentage expressed as a value, 5.0 to 5000.0. The default is 100.0, which corresponds to 100.0%.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting this property causes the control to zoom to the specified value. The Zoom property must be a value between 5.0 to 5000.0 (inclusive), which corresponds to a percentage range 5.0% to 5000.0%. Actions or commands that require a layout update may change the Zoom property setting. For example, changing the value of , calling the method, or invoking the can cause the Zoom setting to change. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ZoomProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom%2A> dependency property.
